rows.title: A challenge with alcohol or drugs

title.eng: A challenge with alcohol or drugs

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about challenges you or a loved one are experiencing with alcohol or drugs?**

**Alcoholics Anonymous (AA)**
AA offers free, anonymous support for people who want to stop drinking. Meetings take place across South Africa.
📞 National Helpline (24/7): 0861 435 722
🌐 www.aasouthafrica.org.za

**Al-Anon Family Groups**
Al-Anon supports anyone affected by a loved one’s drinking. Meetings are free, safe, and confidential.
📞 National Helpline: 086 125 2666
🌐 www.alanon.org.za

**Nar-Anon Family Groups**
Nar-Anon provides support to family and friends of people struggling with drug addiction.
📞 National Helpline: 088 129 6791
🌐 www.naranon.org.za

**South African National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence (SANCA)**
SANCA offers help with prevention, counselling, and treatment for substance use.
📞 General: 011 892 3829
📞 WhatsApp call: 076 535 1701
🌐 www.sancanational.info

**Department of Social Development (DSD)**
The DSD helpline offers free 24/7 support for substance use and other social issues.
📞 Helpline: 0800 121 314
📩 SMS: 32312

**WhatsApp Chat Line – National Substance Abuse Helpline**
A free WhatsApp chat line for information and support around alcohol or drugs.
📱 WhatsApp: 087 163 2025 (8am–5pm)

rows.title: A legal problem

introduction.eng:
**Do you need legal assistance?**

**Black Sash Helpline**
Black Sash offers free advice on social grants, legal rights, and government services.
📞 Call or WhatsApp: 072 663 3739 / 063 610 1865
🌐 www.blacksash.org.za

**Legal Aid South Africa**
Legal Aid provides free legal services for low-income individuals across many legal issues.
📞 0800 110 110
📩 Send a 'please call me' to: 079 835 7179
🌐 www.legal-aid.co.za

**Refugee Rights Unit – UCT Law Clinic**
Offers legal advice and support for asylum seekers and refugees in South Africa.
📱 WhatsApp (for status): 072 499 8146
📱 WhatsApp (for rights): 078 594 5591
🌐 www.refugeerights.uct.ac.za

**South African Social Security Agency (SASSA)**
SASSA provides information about social grants and who qualifies for support.
🌐 www.sassa.gov.za 
(Click the ‘Social Grants’ tab to review your options)

rows.title: Feeling unsafe at home or in my relationship

title.eng: Feeling unsafe at home or in my relationship

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about feeling unsafe in your home or with your partner?**

**South African Depression and Anxiety Group (SADAG)**
SADAG offers emotional support and referrals for people in distress, including those feeling unsafe at home.
📞 0800 567 567
🌐 www.sadag.org (Online support groups available)

**Gender-Based Violence (GBV) Command Centre**
The GBV helpline offers 24/7 support for anyone experiencing abuse or violence.
📞 0800 428 428
📩 Send a ‘please call me’ to: *120*7867#

rows.title: A referral related to violence

introduction.eng:
**Do you need to find referrals for challenges relating to violence**?

**Crime Stop (South African Police Service)**
Report crimes or suspicious activity anonymously.
📞 0860 010 111

**Childline South Africa**
Free 24/7 support for children and anyone concerned about a child’s safety.
📞 116
🌐 www.childlinesa.org.za

**Gender-Based Violence (GBV) Command Centre**
24/7 help for anyone experiencing abuse or gender-based violence.
📞 0800 428 428
📩 Send a ‘please call me’ to: *120*7867#

**Thuthuzela Care Centres (TCCs)**
Support for survivors of rape and sexual violence, including medical care and counselling.
🌐 Find your nearest TCC: www.gov.za/TCC

**Safeline (Male Survivor Helpline)**
Confidential support for boys and men affected by sexual abuse or violence.
📞 0800 035 553

Refugee Support (Scalabrini Centre)
Legal and psychosocial help for refugee children and families.
📱 WhatsApp (children): 063 656 5080
📱 WhatsApp (refugee rights): 078 594 5591
🌐 www.scalabrini.org.za

rows.title: A challenge in my family

introduction.eng:
**Do you need more information or support in managing a challenge in your family?**

**Department of Social Development (DSD)**
Offers support with family issues, child welfare, and elder care. 
📞 0800 220 250 (Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm)
🚩 Visit your local DSD office (Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm)

**ACVV (Afrikaanse Christelike Vroue Vereniging)**
Supports families in crisis through social work, child protection, and community services.
🌐 www.acvv.org.za

**Badisa**
Faith-based organisation offering social support for families, children, the elderly, and people with disabilities.
🌐 www.badisa.org.za

**Childline South Africa**
24/7 helpline for children or families needing support, guidance, or to report abuse.
📞 116
🌐 www.childlinesa.org.za

rows.title: A health referral

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to talk to someone about your health questions?**

**AIDS Helpline (National Department of Health)**
Free, confidential support on HIV, treatment, testing, and prevention.
📞 0800 012 322

**Cancer Association of South Africa (CANSA)**
Support, screening info, and referrals for cancer-related health concerns.
📞 0800 226 622
🌐 www.cansa.org.za

**Marie Stopes South Africa**
Support for family planning, abortion, and sexual health.
📞 0800 117 785
🌐 www.mariestopes.org.za

**Lifeline South Africa**
Counselling for sexual health, relationships, and unplanned pregnancy.
📞 0861 322 322
🌐 www.lifeline.org.za

**Termination of Pregnancy Services**
Public info on safe and legal abortion options.
📞 Department of Health 012 395 8000 
🌐 https://www.gov.za/services/services-residents/birth/terminate-pregnancy

**Men’s Sexual Health (including circumcision)**
Ask the professional nurse at your local clinic for free advice and services.

rows.title: A disability

introduction.eng:
**Would you like to find someone to talk to for support regarding disability?**

**Department of Social Development (DSD)**
Provides disability grants, support services, and referrals through offices across South Africa.
📞 Contact your local DSD office

**National Disability WhatsApp Support Line**
General guidance and referrals for all disabilities.
📱 WhatsApp: 081 517 8757
🌐 www.wcapd.org.za (based in Western Cape, assists nationally)

**South African Disability Alliance (SADA)**
A national network of organisations supporting persons with disabilities across different sectors.
🌐 www.sada.org.za

**BlindSA**
Offers support, advocacy, and accessible resources for blind and visually impaired persons.
📞 Helpline: 060 967 0258
🌐 www.blindsa.org.za

**Autism South Africa**
Information, resources, and guidance for families and individuals living with autism.
🌐 www.aut2know.co.za
